title: To Kill a Mockingbird
author: Harper Lee
description: A novel about the serious issues of race class and gender in the American South seen through the eyes of a young girl.

author: George Orwell
description: A dystopian novel set in a totalitarian society ruled by Big Brother exploring themes of surveillance truth and individuality.

title: Pride and Prejudice
author: Jane Austen
description: A classic novel that critiques the British landed gentry and explores themes of love reputation and class.

title: The Great Gatsby
author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
description: A tale of the American Dream gone wrong chronicling the life of Jay Gatsby and his love for Daisy Buchanan.

title: Moby-Dick
author: Herman Melville
description: An epic tale of obsession and revenge as Captain Ahab hunts the elusive white whale Moby Dick.

title: War and Peace
author: Leo Tolstoy
description: A historical novel that intertwines the lives of families during the Napoleonic Wars in Russia.

title: The Catcher in the Rye
author: J.D. Salinger
description: A coming-of-age story that follows Holden Caulfield a teenager who struggles with the complexities of adulthood.

title: Brave New World
author: Aldous Huxley
description: A dystopian novel that explores a future society driven by technological advancements and conformity.

title: The Alchemist
author: Paulo Coelho
description: A philosophical tale about a shepherd named Santiago who dreams of discovering a treasure hidden near the Egyptian pyramids.

title: One Hundred Years of Solitude
author: Gabriel García Márquez
description: A multi-generational story that explores the Buendía family's experiences in the fictional town of Macondo.

title: Jane Eyre
author: Charlotte Brontë
description: A novel that follows the life of an orphaned girl as she grows up faces adversity and finds love.

title: The Picture of Dorian Gray
author: Oscar Wilde
description: A philosophical novel about a man who remains eternally young while a portrait of him ages and reflects his moral decay.

title: Fahrenheit 451
author: Ray Bradbury
description: A dystopian novel that depicts a future where books are banned and 'firemen' burn any that are found.

title: The Hobbit
author: J.R.R. Tolkien
description: A fantasy novel about the adventures of Bilbo Baggins a hobbit who embarks on a quest with a group of dwarves.

title: Les Misérables
author: Victor Hugo
description: A sweeping historical novel that explores themes of justice redemption and love through the lives of various characters in France.

title: Crime and Punishment

description: A psychological novel that follows a young man who commits murder and grapples with guilt and redemption.

title: The Grapes of Wrath

description: A powerful depiction of the struggles of a family during the Great Depression as they migrate to California.

title: The Catch-22

description: A satirical novel that critiques the absurdities of war and bureaucracy through the experiences of a U.S. Army Air Forces B-25 bombardier.

title: Animal Farm
author: George Orwell
description: An allegorical novella that satirizes totalitarianism through a group of farm animals who overthrow their human farmer.

title: The Brothers Karamazov
author: Fyodor Dostoevsky
description: A philosophical novel that delves into deep moral and spiritual questions through the lives of the Karamazov brothers.

title: Little Women
author: Louisa May Alcott
description: A coming-of-age novel about the lives relationships and personal growth of the four March sisters during the Civil War era.

title: The Old Man and the Sea
author: Ernest Hemingway
description: A short novel that tells the story of an aging fisherman who struggles with a giant marlin far out in the Gulf Stream.

title: The Road
author: Cormac McCarthy
description: A post-apocalyptic novel that follows a father and son as they journey through a devastated landscape struggling for survival.

title: The Secret Garden
author: Frances Hodgson Burnett
description: A children’s novel about a young girl who discovers a neglected garden and transforms it with the help of new friends.

title: Life of Pi
author: Yann Martel
description: A fantastical survival story of a young boy stranded on a lifeboat with a Bengal tiger in the Pacific Ocean.

title: Slaughterhouse-Five
author: Kurt Vonnegut
description: A science fiction-infused anti-war novel that follows the life of Billy Pilgrim who becomes 'unstuck in time'.

title: The Bell Jar
author: Sylvia Plath
description: A semi-autobiographical novel that explores themes of identity mental illness and the struggles of a young woman in 1950s America.

title: The Kite Runner
author: Khaled Hosseini
description: A poignant tale of friendship and redemption set against the backdrop of a changing Afghanistan.
